2860.53.text: perspective can always be very helpful in articulating like,

2864.22.text: okay, I need to understand the context of where people came

2866.34.text: in and where they're going to.

2867.98.text: So I like this one called core and paths where instead

2872.19.text: of just, you know, on a discreet page

2874.42.text: of your deliverables showing what the page is,

2878.51.text: you're sort of showing the broader context around it.

2881.52.text: So it has some things on where people are coming from

2883.93.text: and where they're going to and what they're looking for.

2888.60.text: Targets, just two for this one.

2891.14.text: Personas. If you don't have them,

2893.79.text: I'd really recommend working on them.

2896.74.text: There's a just whole wealth of literature out there online

2899.98.text: around persona driven design, but it's just describing

2902.86.text: and articulating who it is that you're trying to reach

2905.21.text: and being very intentional and specific about that

2909.04.text: and I also think understanding our channels is very

2912.29.text: important, knowing all of the sites that we have,

2915.63.text: knowing all the social accounts that we have,

2918.33.text: and kind of keeping that list visible during design

2922.55.text: projects, during your thinking phases can really help you

2929.54.text: And for tone I just have one that I would like to share.

2934.07.text: A lot of people do personas.

2936.32.text: I don't find empathy maps to be as common.

2940.02.text: It's like you can sort of tactically apply it to a persona.

2943.02.text: So you have personas that maybe work

2946.64.text: but now you have a very specific project

2948.39.text: that you're working on, a specific task and situation,

2950.81.text: and so you could take that same person,

2952.92.text: put them in a new situation,

2954.47.text: and use an empathy map technique,

2956.40.text: which gets at what they're thinking, what they're feeling,

2958.74.text: what they're hearing, and I find that very helpful.

2963.86.text: So if you find yourself saying, "I don't understand,"

2967.63.text: if you're hearing that from your team, take a breath,

2971.09.text: step back a little bit, try and abstract things,

2974.94.text: Hopefully this diagram can help, and yeah,

2978.58.text: don't be afraid to be a little ornery about some

2983.52.text: So I think it's really important, and that's it.

2995.30.text: I ran a little long, so thank you folks at home,

2997.70.text: I'm going to jet out of here in respect to the next speaker,

3000.46.text: but if you would like the slides, kubie.co/VMT.

3002.46.text: I'm around through the end of the day,

3004.63.text: and I'll be at whatever the thing is tonight.

3006.51.text: So feel free to grab me and chat.
